header.title: The Scroll of Set - Issue Number 117

central_thesis: This compilation of articles explores the core Setian philosophy of individual self-divinization and conscious evolution through the 'Gift of Set,' which grants self-consciousness and awareness. It delves into the practical application of these principles via magical workings, the pursuit of hidden knowledge (exemplified by 'Runa' and 'Xem'), and the development of self-imposed ethical and aesthetic frameworks, all aimed at transcending conventional limitations and achieving personal divinity on the Left-Hand Path.

structure_content.chapter_title: [1] Thoughts on the Gift of Set and the Elect
structure_content.summary: This article defines the Gift of Set as self-consciousness and the Elect as individuals who are 'aware' beyond mere self-consciousness, pushing past intellectual limits. Set is conceptualized as a Gestalt/archetype, capable of meta-intelligence, which seeks to 'reproduce' by singling out 'children of Set' who dedicate themselves to transformation, potentially triggering neuro-chemical changes.

structure_content.chapter_title: [2] A Working in the Garden of Eden
structure_content.summary: This piece describes a Setian ritual reinterpreting the Garden of Eden story to celebrate knowledge, self-awareness, and creative ability from a Setian perspective, free from Christian guilt. The working involves participants in white sheets and masks, a dramatic reenactment with Eve and the Serpent offering the apple, and then engaging in creative expression through nudity, body paint, and music, symbolizing the discovery of sexuality, creativity, and self-image as a god.

Announces the second issue of 'Radio 666,' an audio cassette program for Setians featuring news, original music, audio drama, and a Setian faerie tale, emphasizing unique interaction and entertainment.

Reports on IV° Recognitions for Robert Robinson and Roland Winkhart, emphasizing the unique and intensely personal journey of each Initiate. It also welcomes back Robertt Neilly at IV° Recognition and his role as CoGrand Master of the Order of the Vampyre, and announces III° Recognition for Adept Peter Rivera for his initiatory state and work with Setian groups.

Suggests Setians develop 'holes' in their 'consciousness filter,' leading to 'the Call' and a pursuit of knowledge that 'normal' people find horrifying. This process is paralleled to 'being touched' by Set, who may have instigated these 'brain-rattling' events.

Describes three artworks: 'Genre Goth' (salute to Gothic horror, focusing on terror), 'Behold the gentleman, Xepera' (collages on the glory of the Dark Prince and the seductive power of Xeper), and 'The Eye of Set' (archetypal eye symbol, representing the psycho-magical force between man and god, the gateway, and the artist's vision), connecting them to Setian philosophy.
A poetic piece describing a terror-filled awakening, a voice from a 'vanished kingdom and temple of deepest black,' and the journey towards unfulfilled desires finding their place.

The author defines self by chosen boundaries, altering assumptions and belief systems to change oneself and the world. Emphasizes uniqueness, freedom from Karma, and moving in higher spheres through indomitable will, contrasting the Elect's 'fire' with the 'dull eyes' of 'everyman.' Describes constructing a 'citadel of self' for magic and becoming a god.

Discusses the editorial policy of 'The Scroll of Set,' specifically addressing the use of pseudonyms in the previous 'Socratic Wrestlemania' section. It includes comments from various Setians (Otto Norbert Schicksal, Don Webb III°, Abaddon the Destroyer, Frater Melinægis, Ronald L. Barrett, Jr. III°, Marie Zajkowski III°, Stephen Flowers, Ronald K. Barrett) debating the nature, purpose, and efficacy of the Setian 'Words' Runa and Xem, particularly regarding the 'hidden' and the pursuit of the 'unknown.'

structure_content.chapter_title: [10] Some Ways to Know When Conclave is Near
structure_content.summary: A humorous list of indicators that the Setian Conclave is approaching, such as stores running out of black clothing, strange requests for day-glo makeup, hoarding SlimFast, and the Priesthood being flooded with recognition requests.

A poetic reflection on an 'insatiable thirst' that leads one away from safety into unknown realms, towards a quest, and to realize divine potential by drinking from the 'dark liquid' of the Grail, illuminated by a 'Black Flame' burning within.

Uses the allegory of a 'house of many doors' to describe the path of the Black Magician. While most people (Right-Hand Path) only choose unlocked doors, the Black Magician 'picks locks' to access esoteric knowledge, altering their path and actualizing futures through the 'Gift of Set,' effectively blazing their own trails in the universe.

Explores Setian behavior as amoral but guided by self-assumed ethics and aesthetics, distinct from societal morality. Emphasizes that this self-governance is crucial for an Initiate's evolution ('Xeper itself') and for the Temple's efficacy as an initiatory organization, enabling the Setian to make appropriate behavioral decisions and take steps toward divinity.

A poetic piece about haunting dreams, a 'darkest of flames' glowing within the heart, and the lucid scent of 'æthyr,' becoming the essence of majesty at night, questioning whether it's a dream or a 'glorious reflection of my potential' and the essence of Becoming.

Discusses the 'operant aspects' of Runa, particularly the power of 'hiding' magical operations through secrecy. It explains a technique of translating wishes from the conscious to the non-ego parts of oneself (e.g., 'sending to Asgard' using Germanic concepts) and describes a ritual involving writing a letter to oneself, invoking Set, then burning the letter (charge) to internalize the wish, using a magical name (e.g., 'Setnakt') hidden in the text to work on deeper levels of the mind.

key_concepts.definition: The self-consciousness of the human race in general, which for the Elect, evolves into a deeper state of 'awareness' where they transcend ordinary intellectual limits.

Members of the human race who are more than just self-conscious; they are 'aware,' often described as 'children of Set,' distinguished by their refusal to accept mental limits and dedication to personal transformation.
A noncorporeal, non-local, quantum event generated and sustained by the collective consciousness of humanity, capable of meta-intelligence, existing as long as Homo Sapiens wondered about the planet.

A core Setian principle of self-creation and Becoming, often described as an informing and defining power that enables individuals to achieve their divine potential. Mentioned as a seductive power leading to manifestation and an initiatory process.

A 'Word' or principle described as 'that which is hidden, perpetually beyond the grasp of the intellect.' It enhances Xeper by allowing unlimited knowledge expansion, acts as a magnet for the Black Magician's will, and is a 'Word of flux and dynamism' that creates new spaces and challenges the Initiate to test and question.

An æonic Word associated with ancient Egypt (Khem) and its mysteries. Described as an abstract, intangible goal that is a 'continuance' and the beginning of the quest for the unknown, comprising both 'known' and 'secret' aspects linked by initiation.

An individual on the Left-Hand Path who actively 'picks locks' (metaphorically) to gain forbidden knowledge, maneuver through objective reality, and consciously actualize desired futures, in contrast to those who follow pre-laid paths.

A spiritual and magical path characterized by the pursuit of individual will, self-divinization, conscious evolution, and the rejection of external moral codes, often involving exploration of 'forbidden' or esoteric knowledge.

Magical practices that leverage the power of 'hiding' operations (secrecy) and conscious intent, by translating wishes or messages from the conscious self to the non-ego, 'divine areas' within oneself to facilitate manifestation.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined across these articles centers on the cultivation of self-awareness and self-creation (Xeper) through magical and philosophical means. It involves a conscious rejection of external societal norms and moralities, replaced by self-imposed ethics and aesthetics to enable individual evolution. Key aspects include exploring the 'hidden' (Runa, Xem) to expand knowledge, engaging in symbolic and literal rituals to express and enhance creative abilities, and using operant magic techniques that leverage secrecy and intention to influence personal and objective reality.
tools: White sheets and masks (for ritual attire)
Red light with dimmer switch (for illumination)
Parchment/paper and writing implements (for operant magic)
Fire/Black Flame (for burning charges in operant magic)
Imagination/Will (the primary tools for self-definition and world alteration)
rituals: Garden of Eden Working: A group psychodrama ritual involving masked participants, a reenactment of Eve and the Serpent offering the apple, and subsequent nudity with body painting to celebrate self-awareness, creativity, and the reclamation of Satanic heritage.

Operant Magic of Runa (Letter to Self): A solitary ritual involving invoking Set, writing a letter to oneself (using a magical name like 'Setnakt' hidden in the text) expressing wishes for understanding and power, reading it aloud, and then burning the letter (charge) with 'Black Flame' to translate the wish from conscious to deeper, non-ego parts of the self.

relevant_quotes.text: The Gift of Set is the self-consciousness (i.e. capable of objective thought about one's self and one's surroundings) of the human race in general. The Elect are members of the human race who are more than just self-conscious; they are aware. What causes this condition of one being Elect?

But it is at this point, where one seems unable to stretch his mind any more, that Setians rise to the top - apart from the rest because of their refusal to accept that limit. Perhaps it is at that moment in one's life where one dedicates oneself to that task that one becomes Elect.
Man looked down and discovered his sexuality. Man looked up and discovered his ability to create. Man looked within and discovered he was as a god and one who could recreate himself in his own image.
Set sees via the eyes of his Elect, and man may only 'see' due to the Gift - the very presence of Set! [It also represents the 'vision' of the artist.]

For I was born a breed apart, one of the few who dare to look unflinchingly at themselves and the world around them, and who would change themselves and their worlds to make those conform to their will!
The Setian who seeks true freedom is not bound by a code of morality. Indeed as the Setian is a dynamic, individual being, any fixed code is stifling to his personal evolution and realization.

“Runa is that which is hidden, perpetually beyond the grasp of the intellect. By attaining to levels of Understanding of what was previously hidden, we push back the barriers and in the process create even greater mysteries beyond."

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection of articles is highly relevant for understanding the foundational tenets and ongoing philosophical discussions within the Temple of Set. It delineates the 'Gift of Set' as humanity's inherent self-consciousness and the 'Elect' as those who actively cultivate this into heightened awareness, a core concept for the Left-Hand Path. The exploration of Xeper, Runa, and Xem provides technical insights into Setian magical evolution, while the practical rituals and discussions on ethics offer a pragmatic framework for practitioners. The debates over 'Words' (Runa vs. Xem) illustrate the dynamic, evolving nature of Setian magical theory, distinguishing it from static dogma.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of Initiates and practitioners within the Temple of Set. It is also highly valuable for academic researchers and practitioners of Western Esotericism, Chaos Magic, and other Left-Hand Path traditions seeking in-depth understanding of modern occult philosophies, particularly those related to self-divinization and conscious evolution through magical practice.
